New Records: Anthony Volpe hit the second grand slam of his career
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe's grand slam catalyzed a season-saving 11-4 victory for the Yankees
Austin Wells launched a solo shot to open the sixth inning and provide the bullpen more room to breathe
Anthony Volpe and Austin Wells executed a double steal in the eighth and both scored
Gleyber Torres hit a three-run homer that eased the edginess
The Yankees pilloried Dodgers mop-up man Brent Honeywell for five runs in the eighth
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts discussed the importance of length from two rookie pitchers, Ben Casparius and Landon Knack
Yankees manager Aaron Boone emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Volpe described the moment as the coolest of his young life
Aaron Boone expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Anthony Volpe said the team would not go down easy and would try to replicate his outing from Game 4
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees became only the fourth team in baseball history and the first since 1970 to avoid a sweep in the World Series when down, 3-0
No team facing a 3-0 deficit has ever forced Game 6
The contest on Wednesday will be a rematch of starters from Game 1
The Dodgers opened the night in punt formation and were unable to score easily
